doc.repnme: Africa - Regional Communications Infrastructure Program Third Adaptable Program Loan : Mozambique eGovernment and Communications Infrastructure Project
doc.abstracts: The objective of the Mozambique eGovernment and Communications Infrastructure Project (MEGCIP), part of the third phase of the Regional Infrastructure Program in Africa is to support the Recipient's efforts to contribute to lower prices for international capacity and extend the geographic reach of broadband networks and to contribute to improved efficiency and transparency through eGovernment applications. There are four components to the project. The first component of the project is enabling environment. This component will provide technical capacity building and advice to the key agencies of government having a direct role in the project. The second component of the project is connectivity. This component will include financing for connectivity in Mozambique through several subcomponents: (a) financing for the establishment or strengthening of the existing Internet Exchange Point (IXP) through technical assistance and purchase of equipment; (b) financing for equipment for the Governments' communications network; and (c) financing for equipment for the setup of the Mozambique Research and Education Network (MoRENet). The third component of the project is eGovernement applications. This component supports the Government of Mozambique's strategic flagship program identified in the national eGovernment strategy, prepared in 2006. The fourth and final component of the project is project management support. This component will consist of financing for project management related issues covering staff salaries, technical assistance, equipment and operating costs, and namely support for hiring key staff such as: (i) a project coordinator based at Ministry of Science and Technology (MCT); (ii) an Ministry of Transport and Communication (MTC) advisor to be staffed at the MTC; (iii) a lead Information technology (IT) architect, and as a minimum; (iii) one procurement manager; (iv) one financial management specialist; (v) a monitoring and evaluation specialist; (vi) a communications specialist; and (vii) environmental expertise as required.
